DOC.brief_summary: In order reach fertilization context IVF , presence high concentration spermatozoa associate high degree sperm metabolism high concentration sperm degradation product , may adversely affect sperm oocyte viability fertilization rate . The effect high concentration sperm use oocyte insemination appear also negative embryo development ( Dumoulin et al 1992* ) . If true , lower sperm concentration oocyte insemination might improve embryo quality result high implantation rate per embryo . Therefore , test hypothesis percentage 8 cell-embryos day 3 IVF significantly high ( 40 % ) insemination low sperm concentration ( 150 000/ml spermatozoon ) insemination high sperm concentration ( 30 % ; group 600 000/ml spermatozoon ) .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Number Inseminated Spermatozoa Subsequent Human Embryonic Development Vitro
DOC.detailed_description: 1 . BACKGROUND In human in-vitro fertilization procedure , oocytes usually inseminate concentration vary 50 000 150 000 spermatozoon per ml fertilization medium . It show increase concentration spermatozoon > 200 000 per ml , result decrease fertilisation rate ( 66,7 % group inseminate 200 000 spermatozoa/ml versus 79,7 % group inseminate 10 000-90 000/ml ; p < 0,001 ) ( Mahadevan Trounson , 1984 ) . These result confirm another study ( Diamond , Rogers et al. , 1985 ) . The reason decrease fertilisation rate unclear speculate presence high concentration sperm metabolism degradation product associate large number spermatozoa may adversely affect sperm oocyte viability . Dumoulin et al . 1992 show increase sperm concentration affect fertilisation rate also embryo development ( Dumoulin , Bras et al. , 1992 ) . Significantly few fast-developing embryo ( 4-cell 5- 8-cell stage ) find day 2 100 000/ml group ( 53.4 % ) 50 000/ml group ( 65.5 % ; p < 0.05 ) . At Leuven University Fertility Centre ( LUFC ) oocytes inseminate traditionally 15 year high sperm concentration ( 600 000/ml spermatozoon ) average concentration publish ( 50 000 200 000 motile sperm/ml ) ( Chen Kattera , 2006 ; Dumoulin , Bras et al. , 1992 ; Racowsky , Combelles et al. , 2003 ) This high concentration insemination may cause low rate 8-cell embryo day 3 observe LUFC compare literature . At LUFC 20 % embryos reach 8-cell stage day 3 . In literature proportion 8 cell embryos Day 3 report 30 37 % ( Chen Kattera , 2006 ; Racowsky , Combelles et al. , 2003 ; Racowsky , Orasanu et al. , 2005 ) . In prospective randomise trial test hypothesis embryo development improve reduce sperm concentration insemination . This first randomised trial show effect inseminate 600 000 spermatozoa/ml embryo development day 3 . 2 . MATERIALS AND METHODS - Patients All patient least four oocyte include study . Furthermore , inclusion study , semen sample day pick-up need total motility count processing least 10 x 106 /ml . All ICSI patient exclude study . - Randomisation For patient , oocytes randomly assign low insemination concentration ( 150 000/ml ) high concentration ( 600 000/ml ) . The randomization do time oocyte retrieval accord principle `` one - one '' . - Results pilot study Before start prospective randomise trial , conduct pilot study check whether fertilisation rate influence reduction insemination concentration . 268 oocyte 21 patient include pilot study . Only patient good prognosis ( define fertilization rate least 70 % previous cycle good sperm parameter : least 10 x 106 motile spermatozoon per ml processing minimal 60 % motile spermatozoon ) select . At first , insemination concentration halve . The fertilisation rate n't change significantly inseminated 300 000 spermatozoon per ml instead 600 000 per ml ( 75 , 9 % versus 68,7 % ; p < 0,05 ) . In second part pilot study concentration lower 150 000/ml . There decrease fertilisation rate reduce number spermatozoon ( 76,6 % 150 000 group versus 83,6 % 600 000 group ; p < 0,05 ) . On day 2 10 percent increase number good quality embryo notice ( 53,1 % 4-cell embryo 150 000 group versus 42,6 % 600 000 group ; p < 0,05 ) . But day 3 difference number good quality embryos observe small group ( 32,7 % 150 000 group versus 36,1 % 600 000 group ; p < 0,05 ) . This pilot study show lowering sperm concentration insemination reduce fertilization rate , may beneficial effect embryo development patient need study confirm trend - Sperm preparation Sperm sample prepare use density gradient centrifugation technique . The sample load Isolate gradient centrifuge 1450 rpm 20 minute . The result pellet wash twice centrifugation . Afterwards , pellet resuspend 0,75 ml fertilization medium . After count sample dilute final concentration 10 x 106 motile spermatozoon per ml ( concentration use high insemination group ) . For low insemination group sperm sample dilute concentration 2.5 x 106 motile spermatozoon per ml . - Embryo culture transfer During oocyte aspiration oocyte divide two group . The oocyte place 750 µl fertilization medium maximum 5 oocyte . After incubation 37°C , oocyte inseminate add 30 µl sperm sample either low high concentration . Fertilization evaluate 18-20h insemination . Embryo quality evaluate day 2 , 3 5 ( cleavage stage , morphology symmetry ) . Depending number fertilize oocyte number previous cycle , embryo transfer perform day 2 , 3 day 5 . According transfer policy Belgian law ( Koninklijk Besluit , 1 juli 2003 ) , best embryo ( ) ( base cleavage stage , morphology symmetry ) transfer uterus . On day transfer surplus embryo sufficient quality cryopreserved . - Outcome variable Power calculation The primary outcome variable study embryo development evaluate number good quality embryos day 2 day 3 ( 7 8 cell stage ) . To test hypothesis percentage 7 8 cell-embryos group low insemination concentration ( 150 000/ml spermatozoon ) significantly high ( 40 % ) percentage group high insemination concentration ( 30 % ) , power calculation reveal 299 embryo need group day 3 ( beta= 0.8 alpha < 0.05 ) . Other outcome variable study fertilization rate , incidence polyspermy , pregnancy rate implantation rate per transfer embryo .
DOC.criteria: All patient laest 4 oocytes A sperm sample total motility count processing least 1000 000 spermatozoon per ml All ICSI cycle
